content.div:
It's been a bleak, cold few months since NBC abruptly "benched" Community, depriving comedy lovers of their weekly dose of blanket forts, Dreamatoriums, paintball battles and bad Batman impressions. But the show is finally returning to NBC's primetime schedule next Thursday and, judging by its newly released trailer, the season's remaining episodes are going to be epic.

According to the promo, the study group has been labelled "The Greendale Seven" for its disruptive shenanigans and is at risk of being expelled. We also get glimpses of a drunken wedding, an attempt by Abed and Troy to "act normal," the return of evil goatees, Britta's terrible Michael Jackson impression, Chang-controlled security guards, plenty of Annie/Jeff 'shipper moments and the biggest pillow fight ever.

So stop crying about Community's absence (we're talking to you, female cast members!), and strap in for the show's triumphant return on March 15 at 8 p.m. ET on NBC.

Watch the trailer for this season's remaining episodes:

Watch a scene from the March 15 episode, "Urban Matrimony and the Sandwich Arts:"

jenm@dose.ca

link.Abstract: We're still streets ahead of Community's March 15th return but, thanks to NBC, we've got a sneak peek at the Greendale gang's comeback episode, "Urban Matrimony and the Sandwich Arts." So what can we expect from the show's "unbenching?" Check out the just released pics to find out.

link.Abstract: An example of internet love Community has received since NBC announced it was benching the show for 30 Rock's return.
link.title: Community

link.Abstract: Inspired by Community's #SixSeasonsAndAMovie campaign, we have a look at some of those lucky television series that were saved from certain death by their devoted fanbase.
link.title: Gallery: TV Saved By Fans

link.Abstract: Camp, the new record from Childish Gambino (a.k.a. Community star Donald Glover) is in stores now. Go behind the scenes of his new album and summer tour -- plus learn what rhymes with "dinner for two."
link.title: Video: Behind the Scenes with Childish Gambino

link.Abstract: NBC announced Monday night that it will be “benching” Community to make room in January for Are You There, Chelsea?, a new comedy based on the life of Chelsea Handler, and the return of 30 Rock.
link.title: NBC 'Benches' Community for 30 Rock

link.Abstract: "People have stopped laughing, bees have stopped making honey and no one has died for 48 hours," Glover says in the video, which was made in conjunction with MTV Canada.
